{{Infobox Officeholder |name = Samir Habashneh |image = |imagesize = |order = |office = Minister of State
Minister of [[Ministry of Agriculture (Jordan)|Agriculture]] |term_start = 9 February 2011 |term_end = 17 October 2011 |predecessor = |successor = |order2 = |office2 = Minister of [[Ministry of the Interior (Jordan)|Interior]] |term_start2 = 2003-2003 with Ali Abu Ragheb |term_end2 = 2003-2005 with Faisal AlFayez |predecessor2 = |successor2 = |order3 = |office3 = [[Senate of Jordan|Senator]] |term_start3 = 2001-2003/ |term_end3 = 2005-2008|predecessor3 = |successor3 = |order4 = |office4 = Minister of [[Ministry of Culture (Jordan)|Culture]] |term_start4 = 1995 |term_end4 = 1996|predecessor4 = |successor4 = |birth_date = {{Birth year and age|1951|11|5|mf=y}} |birth_place = {{flagicon|Jordan}} |death_date = |death_place = |alma_mater = [[Baghdad University]] (BSc 1974) |residence = |profession = [[Minister (government)]] |religion = |spouse = |children = |website = }} '''Samir Habashneh''' (born 1951) is the Minister of State and Minister of Agriculture for [[Jordan]]. He is a former [[Minister of the Interior]]. Born in 1951, Habashneh earned his BSc in [[agricultural engineering]] from [[Baghdad University]] in 1974. He worked in the Agricultural Cooperative Society and then as a consultant at the Ministry of Youth in 1992. In 1993, he became a deputy in Parliament, representing the southern Governorate of [[Al Karak|Karak]]. He was appointed Minister of Culture in 1995 and became a senator in 2001. He was a member of the Jordan First Committee and a member in the Jordanian Parties Committee. He was the Minister of the Interior until April 2005.,{{cite news |title=Jordan Arrests Key Suspect in Rocket Attack |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2005/08/23/international/middleeast/23jordan.html |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=23 August 2005 |accessdate=24 February 2011 }} serving since 9 February 2011. ==See also== *[[Cabinet of Jordan]] And all must know how he fluctuate between Ba'ath to zionism political view , how he start fighting Isreal vision; ending with strong relations with Isreali Agencies, showing an extraordinary effort to Help Isreal Nations to expand in Palestine. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.moa.gov.jo/ Ministry of Agriculture] ''official site'' {{Persondata | NAME =Habashneh, Samir | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 1951 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Habashneh, Samir}} [[Category:Members of the Chamber of Deputies of Jordan]] [[Category:1951 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Government ministers of Jordan]] {{Jordan-politician-stub}}
